title: Insurance
description: Margie falls under the impression that her father has lost all of his money in the stock market. She suspects the worst, when he pays a visit to his life insurance agent.

title: Margie's Mink
description: When Margie receives a mink instead of what she really ordered, she decides to make her father think it a man gave it to her so she could teach him a lesson. But her plan soon backfires when the Mink's foreign owner shows up and announces he wants to marry Margie!

title: Vern's Chums
description: A couple of Vern's old friends from Vaudeville collude with him in a scheme to dissuade Freddie's parents from approving of his relationship with Vern's daughter, Margie.

title: Missing Link
description: When Margie goes to her father for investment advice and he doesn't give her the answer she wants, she decides to look for another investor who will. But when Margie finds that she bought a wrestler, her father hits the rood - and sets out to teach her a lesson. But Margie is determined to show her father she knew what she was doing.

title: Hillbilly Margie
description: In order to get a hillbilly family to sell the stock they have, Margie gets the idea for her and her father to dress up like hillbillies. But when they learn the trade off is to shoot to kill the enemy, they aren't so sure their plan will work.

title: A Horse on Vern
description: A horse wearing a party hat moves in with the Albrights.

title: Vern's New Girlfriend
description: Vern wants to marry his young new girlfriend, but Margie strongly suspects she's a gold digger. Margie and Roberta plot to disrupt the lovebirds' harmony.

title: Margie's Millionth Member
description: Margie forces Vern to eat "Boomies" cereal so the next-door-neighbor boy can win a prize. Vern is concerned because his company represents a rival product. The situation comes to a head just before Margie and Vern are scheduled to appear on a live children's program sponsored by "Boomies" cereal.

title: Meet Mr. Murphy
description: A chimp named Mr. Murphy takes over the Albright household.

title: Margie Babysits
description: When Margie's father agrees to babysit a client's grandson, Margie warns him he's asking for trouble. But trouble is only starting. Before the night is over, the whole town seems to be upset.

title: En Garde
description: A phony duel is staged to prove Verne's love, but he turns the tables when he finds out.

title: Vern's Winter Vacation
description: Vern and Margie get a free trip to Bermuda from Mr. Honeywell, but end up in Palm Beach to help rescue Freddie from a crazy television scheme.

title: Operation Rescue
description: Margie's dad comes home from a trip, and he's carrying extra baggage - a fiancé.

title: Subconscious Approach
description: Margie uses subliminal messaging in her latest scheme to get her dad to take her on a vacation to Havana.

title: Miss Whoozis
description: Margie takes a modeling job, and she tries to keep it a secret from her father. She develops a crush on the photographer, but he doesn't even know her name.

title: Murder in Bermuda
description: Margie becomes convinced that she has witnessed a murder, while peering through binoculars from her Bermuda hotel room window into another widow of the hotel.

title: The Unexpected Guest
description: Margie and Verne become trapped in their own apartment by two very unexpected guests.

title: Hawaii Story
description: Vern's boss wont let him take Margie to Hawaii with on business trip to win a new client who's a semi-retired movie star who's vain about her age and prefers younger men. Vern's boss gets him to dye his hair and pretend to be younger. Vern had told Margie she could go on this trip and he had already acquired the tickets he had to tell her his plans had changed and he was going to Alaska and she could cash in the tickets and use the money for any thing she wanted. Margie and Roberta decide to use the tickets to go to Hawaii instead of cashing them in. Once in Hawaii the competition for the client starts and running into his full grown daughter could put a crimp in his youth based attempt at landing this new client.

title: Corpus Delicti
description: Margie and Freddie track a murderer to a mysterious mansion. Two things Margie doesn't know: The man is a client of her father, and he's never murdered anyone.

title: Papa and Mambo
description: Vern wagers his future with the company against Mr. Honeywell's job as president, in a competition to sign an important client.

title: Vern's Butterflies
description: Margie wants to spend some time with her boyfriend Ted, so she convinces Vern that his prospective client, Mr. Briggs, is vacationing at the lodge enjoying his favorite hobby, catching butterflies. In order to keep Vern busy, she gets the lodge's janitor to pretend to be Mr. Briggs. It seems to be a foolproof scheme--until the actual Mr. Briggs shows up.
